DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 9G Last 24 Hours Pain Interfered with Enjoyment of Life Score 11 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much pain has interfered with enjoyment of life in the last 24 hours, using a 11 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Last 24 Hours Pain Interfered with Enjoyment of Life Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A question about whether a person has or had pain that interfered with their enjoyment of life.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Last Integer Hour Pain Interferes with Enjoyment of Life Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.:A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A question about whether a person has or had pain that interfered with their enjoyment of life.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

Concepts.longName: Pain Interferes with Enjoyment of Life
Concepts.definition: A question about whether a person has or had pain that interfered with their enjoyment of life.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: BPI Pain Interference Score 11 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of pain interference that ranges from 0: Does Not Interfere to 10: Completely Interferes.
